Football fan mascot design - Mongoose

LINK

Instagram profile

MY ROLE

Graphic Designer

CLIENT

Mongoose - Fan club

The "Mongoose" fan club was created in 2020. Their name is a homage to an old bar where the football players would go to relax after their game. They wanted the animal to be presented as a fierce fighter ready to attack and also to be holding a torch representing the fire and the passions for the sport and the football club.

It was clear from the start that this needed to be a more humanised version of the animal to get the desired effect. To make the mascot feel more three-dimensional I slightly sifted its stature and made a part of it leave the bounding circle.

After the design was finished I made multiple version to better work with the background it is on. This design was then adopted by the club and went on to be printed on their merchandise (which is currently just t-shirts and hoodies). Furthermore, I created some concept merchandise not yet available in their store but to present how it works with the green colours of their football team.

Logo/symbol & Album cover design - Piscatores

MY ROLE

Graphic Designer

CLIENT

Piscatores

Piscatores are a church choir from Croatia. They have around 20 active members and perform at around 5-10 different live events each year along with providing music for the mass every Sunday and on all big Holidays.

They have realised one original song which was performed on national television and in front of 2000 people at an "Uskrsfest" festival. Currently, they are working on their first original album and for that, I was asked to create their logo and the accompanying album cover artwork.

Piscatores in Latin translates to fisherman this is why the logo is represented as a fishing pool with some Christian symbols added as details in the piece. Keeping with the theme the self-titled album is an acrylic painting style picture with a lone fisherman in the big ocean representing how one person is doing the task which is suited for many. Furthermore, the fisherman is facing the warm sun showing how they are looking towards the light and moving away from the cold, dark place.

Logo/symbol & poster design for live event - C3U

MY ROLE

Graphic Designer

CLIENT

C3U

Live and Electronic was an event hosted under the C3U Records name. It was an open stage show meant for the live (acoustic-based) performers as well as the electronic live performers. The event had about six live acts, at a student union bar, holding around 50 people.

The event logo/symbol and the poster were showcased physically around the town and campus as well as outside and inside the venue, also on the student union bar Facebook profile, the record labels profile and the events profile page.

Overall it attracted the majority of the audience and got a good response online.

Website redesign & transfer to WordPress - Church of Saint Peter & Paul

LINK

Go to the website

MY ROLE

Lead Web Designer

CLIENT

Church of Saint Peter & Paul

This is an independent project for which I developed a custom WordPress theme specifically designed for the Church. It is connected to their Instagram account for the gallery and has a built-in pdf viewer to provide easier use of the Church's newsletter which is usually printed and also posted on their Facebook.

They required many sites but only a few of them needed to be updated regularly and so for this I created different site templates to make it easier for them to get to and edit the needed content while the static one is still editable it is less customizable considering it is mostly text and a few pictures that are displayed on such pages.

This is an ongoing project, which was stopped midway because of the need for the resources and the time to be used for renovating the Church after a terrible earthquake.

The project will be finished as soon as possible and actually made available for the public to view and use as soon as the administration allows it.

Website design - Programming for web

LINK

Go to the website

MY ROLE

Lead Web DesignerProject Manager

CLIENT

Programming for web

"Programming for web" was created as a collective of students from the "School for graphics, design and media production" where they would be able to work on real-life projects for other schools and companies as a part of their course.

My role in the creation of this website as the first generation of that collective/group was to manage the overall structure and process of the project as well as manipulating the chosen WordPress theme to fit the design esthetic which was decided.

The website is a simple blog-style site meant to showcase the projects these students worked on and explain in a bit more detail on how each project was made and what were some of its challenges.

Website redesign & transfer to WordPress - Radio 808

LINK

Go to the website

MY ROLE

Lead Web DesignerProject Manager

CLIENT

Radio 808

Radio 808 reached out to the "Programming for web" group of students (which I was apart of), they explained their wants and needs for a redesign of their website and transfer to the WordPress CMS system for their ease of use.

For the website, Radio 808 already had a theme active and they wanted to keep it, so what we did is focused on reshaping that theme to fit their needs and the design choices which they wanted.

My part was to manage the project and make sure that all of the content and the design choices are cohesive. This meant we first needed to come up with the general website design looking at what content will occupy the site and how it should be presented. Once that was determined we split the theme into two groups (design and development).

As a lead developer, my team focused on how to manipulate the WordPress theme to get the desired look, making sure that all of the colours and content was easily editable so that when the design is locked in we can go back and quickly change all of the colour and typography to fit.
